title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message:
This came in with water damage, put it in the ultrasonic cleaner and have a green/orange light but wont turn on. U7840 was burned so replaced it but still wont power on. I have 12V but no 3v or 5V

I am new to component level repair. What should I check next?

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message:
resistance to ground on PP3V42_G3H. 

and for corrosion around the BIOS area. there is some ppvttcpu thing next to the bios that always corrodes on those.

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message:
No Title

Bios area looks real good with no corrosion. First picture is where U7840 was replaced. What else should I check?  I have 3.3V around the U7200 area

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: I  have 0V on U7750

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: resistance to ground on PP3V42_G3H!!

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: When I type that into the board view so many different components appear. Which one am I measuring?

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: I checked all resistors that involve  PP3V42_G3H and all of the voltages are present

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: Kyle you must put your multimeter in resistance mode, then you put one wire in ground and the other one in pp3v42_g3h line (it doesnt matter where) and measure the resistance to ground of that line, measure it and post the value. Like if it were a resistor.

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message:
You are answering questions I didn't ask! I do not care what voltage is on PP3V42_G3H. What is the resistance to ground on that bus? You can measure anywhere on the board, at any point. PP3V42_G3H shows up everywhere.

Think of it like me asking for the temperature and weather in area code 10009.

I can measure the temperature outside my store

I can measure the temperature outside the school across the street. 

I can measure the temperature at the grocery store next to the school.

It will be cloudy and raining, at around 47f in any of these locations. :)

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: It appears I have nothing 0 on the resistance to the ground on this line

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message:
[QUOTE="Kyle, post: 2623"]It appears I have nothing 0 on the resistance to the ground on this line[/QUOTE]

That means that PP3V42_G3H is shorted.
So you will need to apply first 0.5V from a power supply in that line and check if anything is getting hot...nothing?ok 0.5V more, total= 1V to a maximum of 3 - 3.42 Volts to that line (pp3v42_g3h)

You can check this video:
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p83LLbSx4WE[/url]

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: Is there a simpler power supply for this procedure I can purchase to apply this power?

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: That's impossible you have green/orange light on the charger and you measured 0 Ohm on the PP3V42_G3H rail!

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: Something is wrong here. Are you in resistance mode? Are you measuring resistance WITHOUT power connected? You can't have 0 ohms of resistance to ground on a line if you also have 3.42v present on that same line.

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: I apologize, without power connected I get 2.60

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: Can someone respond? I reported what I get for resistance to ground

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: 2.6 what exactly? We need more information, try to be thorough with units of measurement. 2.6 ohms, kilohms, megaohms?

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: I had 2.6 ohms

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: Also, I checked F7000 and am only getting 12.20VV, since its suppose to be 12.60V does this mean I have a bad smc?

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: f7000? Do you mean u7000?

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: No it was f7000. Would like suggestion on how to proceed.

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: I'm still not aware of the real resistance of PP3V42_G3H to ground or its voltage. It can't be 2 ohms to ground and 2.6v.

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: It was just 2 ohms

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message:
If it is 2 ohms, then inject 3.42v on PP3V42_G3H and find what gets hot. There is a short. But I still find it hard to believe it is 2 ohms if you measured 2.6v before, something isn't right in these measurements. 

Remove L6995, place 3.42v from bench power supply where pin 2 of L6995 would go, and ground of bench power supply on ground. Is it delivering excessive current? If NOT, try actually plugging the magsafe in after you inject 3.42v and see if it'll give a green light or turn on.

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: Whats a good bench power supply to purchase?

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: Will someone respond?

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: TDK Lambda ZUP20-40 works for me......

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: Anything available that doesn't cost so much?

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: Put two PC power supply in serie, isolate ground from first PSU,  there you will have 24V, 17V, 15V, 12V, 8V, 5V and 3.3V with a lot of amps, if you want variable voltage, use linear regulator LM317, put 5 in parallel to increase amperage on regulated line to about 7.5AMP and a voltage from 1.5V min- 24V max...  This was my first power supply :)

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message:
I have made more progress on this motherboard. I now have my 12V and 3V coils and am only missing my 5V coil after replacing U7200.

What do you check to get 5V coil?

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: You need to turn on the machine to get the 5V from U7200, it's an S3 state power supply.

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: It still wont power on for some reason. What else should I check?

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: How are you turning it on? Disconnect keyboard and use the pads on the board

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: I was using the pads.

title: 820-2530 wont turn on
message: PM_PWRBTN_L toggling when shorting the pads?
